channel.title: What DNS / whois website do you use
channel.description:
What DNS/whois website do you use?
I'm getting sick of the ones that I use, being random from Google search, so I wanted to find a decent one based on what is posted.
Thanks.

item.title: What DNS / whois website do you use
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

I use the command line ‘whois’ tool that you can apt-get install. What else would there be?

Read full topic
item.source: What DNS / whois website do you use

item.title: What DNS / whois website do you use
item.dc:creator: @T41 t4
item.description:
@T41 wrote:

for whois’s who.is, for dns lookup dnslookup using google dns.

Read full topic

@bowserjr2 wrote:

item.title: What DNS / whois website do you use
item.dc:creator: @siva12 siva12
item.description:
@siva12 wrote:

[quote=“zachera, post:1, topic:387593”]What DNS/whois website do you use?

I’m getting sick of the ones that I use, being random from Google search, so I wanted to find a decent one based on what is posted.

Thanks.[/quote]

You can use this http://www.whoisxy.com/ .Here i found DNS lookup and whois lookup (for both ip and domain name). Its free service…

That was not a question you candy-brained fuck.

I read “Not Sure” as an response to a question, ignore the comment I made anyway because I was intoxicated.

item.title: What DNS / whois website do you use
item.dc:creator: @Mopman Mopman
item.description:
@Mopman wrote:

Moparisthebest:

I think Mopman was saying that ftp shouldn’t be installed by default, and instead should be installed by the user only if he needs it.

That is what I was saying. FTP is outdated, superseded by lots of newer things, and nobody should be using it.

Should Windows include a gopher client? :>

Read full topic

item.title: What DNS / whois website do you use
item.dc:creator: @z z
item.description:
@z wrote:

[quote=“cumescape, post:6, topic:387593”]C:\Users\Aaron>whois moparisthebest.com
‘whois’ is not recognized as an internal or external command,
operable program or batch file.[/quote]http://technet.microsoft.com/en-us/sysinternals/bb897435
Download and place in C:\Windows\System32\

[quote=“Newty, post:7, topic:387593”]download the whois tool from microsoft
cd dir/you/extracted/to
whois domainname[/quote]If it’s placed in C:\WINDOWS\System32, you can access it through cmd by typing `whois’.

Read full topic
